8.62.text: What we're going to do is, we're going to transform this

10.06.text: into a really cool van for Jess for her tour

13.12.text: We're going to remove the main bulkhead, which just

14.98.text: makes it a lot nicer and less builder-like

19.36.text: We found a V-Class that's being broken

20.94.text: down in Portsmouth so we're going to head down there

22.76.text: and rip the seats out of that

30.42.text: So the first package has arrived from eBay

33.20.text: Little bit of tweaking, that'll be lovely

34.94.text: We've got to get this, it's what the A-team would do

43.58.text: I'll get started fabricating the seat mounts then

47.72.text: It's getting this spacing here that's the hard bit

52.38.text: Oh, this is making my brain melt

56.32.text: Actually, do you know what? That's alright.

63.38.text: Plenty of leg room like that, so we're not going to

68.08.text: kind of gives it the 70s vibe, being shiny

70.40.text: and also will protect the rear bumper as well

85.70.text: to get a metal flake wrap is going to be the right solution

88.62.text: I've also found there's a company more locally

91.74.text: that does the wrapping as well as the vinyl supply

94.38.text: We're going to heat the vinyl up and trim it all up

96.72.text: and hopefully if we do a good job it'll look brilliant

107.18.text: I think it's going to be another late night tonight

108.98.text: There's always this doubt in my mind if we're

110.52.text: going to finish this or not, ha!

121.98.text: I can't believe we're getting this close to the deadline

123.86.text: and there's still this much to do

129.42.text: Taking the seats out on the front, seems really simple...

133.34.text: We've actually found the solution we want

135.34.text: which means we can fit the Mercedes seat

145.06.text: this is actually out of a different vehicle

148.50.text: and this is so that Jess can hopefully make the

150.22.text: transition from her wheelchair into the van

156.36.text: If it can pull me up, it can certainly pull her up

163.16.text: When she gets to see it, I'd love to think that

165.16.text: this would really raise a giggle with her

166.56.text: Yep, side windows. That's the sort of thing we're after

180.94.text: Silly o'clock in the morning, I think

182.42.text: I haven't looked at my watch and I daren't

200.26.text: I was really glad to see it finished

201.20.text: and see it all come together

203.12.text: I actually felt quite proud of it to be honest

205.22.text: it was constantly this sort of strive

208.44.text: something that would just put the biggest smile

210.90.text: I realised that all the stress and the late nights

213.78.text: were worth it, without a doubt

220.06.text: Look at the attention to detail!

225.06.text: I just picture her with that lovely smile of hers

228.20.text: every time she discovers some other element

230.04.text: that we've put into the van

231.30.text: I could never have imagined it would be that good

238.00.text: All of those elements just really pushed together

240.10.text: to make it something a bit unique and special

242.00.text: Happiness is a van in blue!
